          <pre class="json">{
    <span class="hljs-attr">"$ref"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"#/definitions/TsConfigSchema"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"$schema"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"definitions"</span>: {
        <span class="hljs-attr">"ModuleTypes"</span>: {
            <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"object"</span>
        },
        <span class="hljs-attr">"TsConfigOptions"</span>: {
            <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Must be an interface to support `typescript-json-schema`."</span>,
            <span class="hljs-attr">"properties"</span>: {
                <span class="hljs-attr">"compiler"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"typescript"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Specify a custom TypeScript compiler."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"compilerHost"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Use TypeScript's compiler host API instead of the language service API."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"compilerOptions"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"additionalProperties"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"allOf"</span>: [
                        {
                            <span class="hljs-attr">"$ref"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://schemastore.azurewebsites.net/schemas/json/tsconfig.json#definitions/compilerOptionsDefinition/properties/compilerOptions"</span>
                        }
                    ],
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"JSON object to merge with TypeScript `compilerOptions`."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"properties"</span>: {},
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"object"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"emit"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Emit output files into `.ts-node` directory."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"esm"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Enable native ESM support.\n\nFor details, see https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/imports#native-ecmascript-modules"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"experimentalReplAwait"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Allows the usage of top level await in REPL.\n\nUses node's implementation which accomplishes this with an AST syntax transformation.\n\nEnabled by default when tsconfig target is es2018 or above. Set to false to disable.\n\n**Note**: setting to `true` when tsconfig target is too low will throw an Error.  Leave as `undefined`\nto get default, automatic behavior."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"experimentalResolver"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Enable experimental features that re-map imports and require calls to support:\n`baseUrl`, `paths`, `rootDirs`, `.js` to `.ts` file extension mappings,\n`outDir` to `rootDir` mappings for composite projects and monorepos.\n\nFor details, see https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node/issues/1514"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"experimentalSpecifierResolution"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Like node's `--experimental-specifier-resolution`, , but can also be set in your `tsconfig.json` for convenience.\n\nFor details, see https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v18.x/docs/api/esm.html#customizing-esm-specifier-resolution-algorithm"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"enum"</span>: [
                        <span class="hljs-string">"explicit"</span>,
                        <span class="hljs-string">"node"</span>
                    ],
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"experimentalTsImportSpecifiers"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Allow using voluntary `.ts` file extension in import specifiers.\n\nTypically, in ESM projects, import specifiers must have an emit extension, `.js`, `.cjs`, or `.mjs`,\nand we automatically map to the corresponding `.ts`, `.cts`, or `.mts` source file.  This is the\nrecommended approach.\n\nHowever, if you really want to use `.ts` in import specifiers, and are aware that this may\nbreak tooling, you can enable this flag."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"files"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Load \"files\" and \"include\" from `tsconfig.json` on startup.\n\nDefault is to override `tsconfig.json` \"files\" and \"include\" to only include the entrypoint script."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"ignore"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: [
                        <span class="hljs-string">"(?:^|/)node_modules/"</span>
                    ],
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Paths which should not be compiled.\n\nEach string in the array is converted to a regular expression via `new RegExp()` and tested against source paths prior to compilation.\n\nSource paths are normalized to posix-style separators, relative to the directory containing `tsconfig.json` or to cwd if no `tsconfig.json` is loaded.\n\nDefault is to ignore all node_modules subdirectories."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"items"</span>: {
                        <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>
                    },
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"array"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"ignoreDiagnostics"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Ignore TypeScript warnings by diagnostic code."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"items"</span>: {
                        <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: [
                            <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>,
                            <span class="hljs-string">"number"</span>
                        ]
                    },
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"array"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"logError"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Logs TypeScript errors to stderr instead of throwing exceptions."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"moduleTypes"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"$ref"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"#/definitions/ModuleTypes"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Override certain paths to be compiled and executed as CommonJS or ECMAScript modules.\nWhen overridden, the tsconfig \"module\" and package.json \"type\" fields are overridden, and\nthe file extension is ignored.\nThis is useful if you cannot use .mts, .cts, .mjs, or .cjs file extensions;\nit achieves the same effect.\n\nEach key is a glob pattern following the same rules as tsconfig's \"include\" array.\nWhen multiple patterns match the same file, the last pattern takes precedence.\n\n`cjs` overrides matches files to compile and execute as CommonJS.\n`esm` overrides matches files to compile and execute as native ECMAScript modules.\n`package` overrides either of the above to default behavior, which obeys package.json \"type\" and\ntsconfig.json \"module\" options."</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"preferTsExts"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Re-order file extensions so that TypeScript imports are preferred.\n\nFor example, when both `index.js` and `index.ts` exist, enabling this option causes `require('./index')` to resolve to `index.ts` instead of `index.js`"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"pretty"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Use pretty diagnostic formatter."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"require"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Modules to require, like node's `--require` flag.\n\nIf specified in `tsconfig.json`, the modules will be resolved relative to the `tsconfig.json` file.\n\nIf specified programmatically, each input string should be pre-resolved to an absolute path for\nbest results."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"items"</span>: {
                        <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>
                    },
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"array"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"scope"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Scope compiler to files within `scopeDir`."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"scopeDir"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"First of: `tsconfig.json` \"rootDir\" if specified, directory containing `tsconfig.json`, or cwd if no `tsconfig.json` is loaded."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"skipIgnore"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Skip ignore check, so that compilation will be attempted for all files with matching extensions."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"swc"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Transpile with swc instead of the TypeScript compiler, and skip typechecking.\n\nEquivalent to setting both `transpileOnly: true` and `transpiler: 'ts-node/transpilers/swc'`\n\nFor complete instructions: https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/transpilers"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"transpileOnly"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Use TypeScript's faster `transpileModule`."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"transpiler"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"anyOf"</span>: [
                        {
                            <span class="hljs-attr">"items"</span>: [
                                {
                                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>
                                },
                                {
                                    <span class="hljs-attr">"additionalProperties"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
                                    <span class="hljs-attr">"properties"</span>: {},
                                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"object"</span>
                                }
                            ],
                            <span class="hljs-attr">"maxItems"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">2</span>,
                            <span class="hljs-attr">"minItems"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">2</span>,
                            <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"array"</span>
                        },
                        {
                            <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"string"</span>
                        }
                    ],
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Specify a custom transpiler for use with transpileOnly"</span>
                },
                <span class="hljs-attr">"typeCheck"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"default"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"**DEPRECATED** Specify type-check is enabled (e.g. `transpileOnly == false`)."</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"boolean"</span>
                }
            },
            <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"object"</span>
        },
        <span class="hljs-attr">"TsConfigSchema"</span>: {
            <span class="hljs-attr">"allOf"</span>: [
                {

                }
            ],

            <span class="hljs-attr">"properties"</span>: {
                <span class="hljs-attr">"ts-node"</span>: {
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"$ref"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"#/definitions/TsConfigOptions"</span>,
                    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"ts-node options.  See also: https://typestrong.org/ts-node/docs/configuration\n\nts-node offers TypeScript execution and REPL for node.js, with source map support."</span>
                }
            },
            <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"object"</span>
        }
    }
}
